ovdesc.p: A user of T24 has the facility using this file to set up parameters relating to a banks' holding in various assets.
He can, for example indicate that the banks' policy for U.S. dollar equities is to hold no more than 50% in the total for all security portfolio's.

Periodically he will obtain a print out of the details relating to that particular holding by customer, in the form of an investment policy comparison where the policy plan would be displayed against the actual percentage holding. The user can also input a variance ratio of say 5% and get a periodic warning list of each position which then differs from the policy plan.

This field denotes a period of time that defines the end of a maturity band and is normally used in conjunction with the field MAT.START . In practise, the remaining life to maturity (in days) for the bond is calculated using the maturity date on the SECURITY.MASTER file. The result is then applied to the maturity band to determine whether or not the bond falls into this band. This field is used for Portfolio modelling and reporting/enquiry purposes.
Example :

16.1.1 MAT.START 0D (greater than/equal to 0 days) 17.1.1 MAT.END 6M (less than 6 months) 16.1.2 MAT.START 6M (greater than/equal to 6 months) 17.1.2 MAT.END 1Y (less than 1 year) 16.1.3 MAT.START 1Y (greater than/equal to 1 year) 17.1.3 MAT.END 3Y (less than 3 years) 16.1.4 MAT.START 3Y (greater than/equal to 3 years) 17.1.4 MAT.END 10Y (less than 10 years) 16.1.5 MAT.START 10Y (greater than/equal to 10 years) 17.1.5 MAT.END (as above i.e. infinity)
Optional Input
If the field is not entered portfolio modelling processing will not group bonds by maturity band
If this field is populated, bonds will be grouped by maturity bands for modelling and reporting purposes.
The Country of Exposure. Used with the associated SUB.ASSET.TYPE field to define portfolio model elements.

The key for the POLICY.PARAMETER record can either be a free format like HIGHRISK or a COMPANY to which the user must be signed on in order to use the application.

1 - 11 Alphanumeric charcters. or 9 alphanumeric characters 'CCGGGLLLL' where: CC is 2 alpha characters country code GGG is 3 numeric characters company group LLLL is 4 numeric local code. or 2-3 type MNE (uppercase alphanumeric or '.') company mnemonic characters. (Mandatory Input)
If a COMPANY.CODE entered then the user must be signed on to that Company.
